snippet: Standard Chartered, motivated by the millions of dollars it reaped in fees, schemed with the Iranian government to launder $250 billion, New York’s banking regulator said.
abstract: New York State Financial Services Dept accuses Britain's Standard Chartered Bank of scheming with Iran to launder $250 billion, leaving the United States financial system vulnerable to terrorists and corrupt regimes; requires the bank to explain the apparent violations of law in a hearing and justify why its license to operate in New York should not be revoked.
lead_paragraph: Standard Chartered, motivated by the millions of dollars it reaped in fees, schemed with the Iranian government to launder $250 billion, New York’s banking regulator said.

headline.seo: British Bank Accused of Hiding Transactions With Iran
headline.main: Regulator Says British Bank Helped Iran Hide Deals
headline.print_headline: Regulator Says Bank Helped Iran Hide Deals
